# Uncapitalize

> Uncapitalize the first character of a string.

<section class="usage">

## Usage

``` javascript
var uncapitalize = require( '@stdlib/string/uncapitalize' );
```

#### uncapitalize( str )

Uncapitalizes the first character of a `string`.

``` javascript
var out = uncapitalize( 'Last man standing' );
// returns 'last man standing'

out = uncapitalize( 'Hidden Treasures' );
// returns 'hidden Treasures';
```

<!-- </usage> -->


<section class="examples">

## Examples

``` javascript
var uncapitalize = require( '@stdlib/string/uncapitalize' );

var out;

out = uncapitalize( 'Last man standing' );
// returns  'last man standing'

out = uncapitalize( 'Presidential election' );
// returns 'presidential election'

out = uncapitalize( 'JavaScript' );
// returns 'javaScript'

out = uncapitalize( 'Hidden Treasures' );
// returns 'hidden Treasures';
```

<!-- </examples> -->


---

<section class="cli">

## CLI


<section class="usage">

### Usage

``` bash
Usage: uncapitalize [options] string

Options:

  -h,    --help                Print this message.
  -V,    --version             Print the package version.
```

<!-- </usage> -->


<section class="examples">

### Examples

``` bash
$ uncapitalize Beep
beep
```

<!-- </examples> -->

<!-- </cli> -->
